channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: An Image is Worth One Word: Personalizing Text-to-Image Generation using Textual Inversion
item.description: Yet, it is unclear how such freedom can be exercised to generate images of specific unique concepts, modify their appearance, or compose them in new roles and novel scenes.

item.title: PeRFception: Perception using Radiance Fields
item.description: The recent progress in implicit 3D representation, i. e., Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), has made accurate and photorealistic 3D reconstruction possible in a differentiable manner.

item.title: YOLOPv2: Better, Faster, Stronger for Panoptic Driving Perception
item.description: Over the last decade, multi-tasking learning approaches have achieved promising results in solving panoptic driving perception problems, providing both high-precision and high-efficiency performance.

item.title: Audio-Visual Segmentation
item.description: To deal with the AVS problem, we propose a novel method that uses a temporal pixel-wise audio-visual interaction module to inject audio semantics as guidance for the visual segmentation process.

item.title: NeuMan: Neural Human Radiance Field from a Single Video
item.description: Photorealistic rendering and reposing of humans is important for enabling augmented reality experiences.

item.title: In Defense of Online Models for Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: In recent years, video instance segmentation (VIS) has been largely advanced by offline models, while online models gradually attracted less attention possibly due to their inferior performance.

item.title: Topology-aware Convolutional Neural Network for Efficient Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: In particular, we develop a novel cross-channel feature augmentation module, which is a combo of map-attend-group-map operations.

item.title: Cold Diffusion: Inverting Arbitrary Image Transforms Without Noise
item.description: We observe that the generative behavior of diffusion models is not strongly dependent on the choice of image degradation, and in fact an entire family of generative models can be constructed by varying this choice.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Text-Guided Synthesis of Artistic Images with Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models
item.description: In RDMs, a set of nearest neighbors is retrieved from an external database during training for each training instance, and the diffusion model is conditioned on these informative samples.

item.title: Federated Learning via Decentralized Dataset Distillation in Resource-Constrained Edge Environments
item.description: We introduce a novel federated learning framework, FedD3, which reduces the overall communication volume and with that opens up the concept of federated learning to more application scenarios in network-constrained environments.

item.title: FedDM: Iterative Distribution Matching for Communication-Efficient Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning~(FL) has recently attracted increasing attention from academia and industry, with the ultimate goal of achieving collaborative training under privacy and communication constraints.

item.title: Multi-scale Multi-band DenseNets for Audio Source Separation
item.description: This paper deals with the problem of audio source separation.

item.title: Individual Tree Detection in Large-Scale Urban Environments using High-Resolution Multispectral Imagery
item.description: We introduce a novel deep learning method for detection of individual trees in urban environments using high-resolution multispectral aerial imagery.

item.title: towhee
item.description: Towhee is a framework that is dedicated to making neural data processing pipelines simple and fast.

item.title: Fast Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search With The Navigating Spreading-out Graph
item.description: In this paper, to further improve the search-efficiency and scalability of graph-based methods, we start by introducing four aspects: (1) ensuring the connectivity of the graph; (2) lowering the average out-degree of the graph for fast traversal; (3) shortening the search path; and (4) reducing the index size.

item.title: USB: A Unified Semi-supervised Learning Benchmark
item.description: Semi-supervised learning (SSL) improves model generalization by leveraging massive unlabeled data to augment limited labeled samples.

item.title: Revisiting and Advancing Fast Adversarial Training Through The Lens of Bi-Level Optimization
item.description: We first show that the commonly-used Fast-AT is equivalent to using a stochastic gradient algorithm to solve a linearized BLO problem involving a sign operation.

item.title: Training and Tuning Generative Neural Radiance Fields for Attribute-Conditional 3D-Aware Face Generation
item.description: To this end, we introduce a conditional GNeRF model that uses specific attribute labels as input in order to improve the controllabilities and disentangling abilities of 3D-aware generative models.

item.title: Arbitrary Shape Text Detection via Segmentation with Probability Maps
item.description: To be concrete, we adopt a Sigmoid Alpha Function (SAF) to transfer the distances between boundaries and their inside pixels to a probability map.
